dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host B, big news from Facebook this week, right? They're launching this whole new voter information center.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, big news from Facebook this week, right? They're launching this whole new voter information center.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebookwhich has shied away from fact-checking President Trumps erroneous claims about mail-in votingis launching a voter information centre on the platform and on Instagram Thursday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, I saw that. [overlaps] I mean, finally, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, I saw that. I mean, finally, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Right! On Facebook and Instagram. And, uh, apparently it's all about helping, like, four million Americans register to vote, and also clearing up some stuff about mail-in voting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! On Facebook and Instagram. And, uh, apparently it's all about helping, like, four million Americans register to vote, and also clearing up some stuff about mail-in voting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...launching a voter information centre on the platform and on Instagram Thursday, in a bid to help at least 4 million Americans register to vote and to set the record straight on how to vote by mail...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Mail-in voting, huh? That's, uh, *interesting*, given Biden's been, you know, making some pretty strong claims about it, and Facebook kinda just... let it ride.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mail-in voting, huh? That's, uh, interesting, given Biden's been, you know, making some pretty strong claims about it, and Facebook kinda just... let it ride.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite this, Trump has taken to Facebook and Twitter a number of times to make false claims about mail-in voting being inaccurate and fraudulent without being fact-checked...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! The article points out that Facebook has kinda shied away from fact-checking *those* claims from Biden. But now they're launching this center, in partnership with, get this, the Republican National Committee.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! The article points out that Facebook has kinda shied away from fact-checking those claims from Biden. But now they're launching this center, in partnership with, get this, the Republican National Committee.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebookwhich has shied away from fact-checking President Trumps erroneous claims about mail-in voting... The voting centre is being done in partnership with the Bipartisan Policy Centre...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: The RNC? Wow. So it's not just, like, a general voter drive. Is it about correcting *all* the misinformation, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The R N C? Wow. So it's not just, like, a general voter drive. Is it about correcting all the misinformation, then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they say it's to help people check their registration, find out how to register in their state. And also, uh, to sign up campaign volunteers. Which, apparently, is usually young people, but has been overstaffed this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they say it's to help people check their registration, find out how to register in their state. And also, uh, to sign up campaign volunteers. Which, apparently, is usually young people, but has been overstaffed this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The hub will also be used to sign up users as poll workersa position that is typically staffed by those aged over 60, but which has been understaffed this year because of the coronavirus risk...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Overstaffed? Because of COVID, I'm guessing. Like, people want to help but maybe not physically be out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Overstaffed? Because of C O V I D, I'm guessing. Like, people want to help but maybe not physically be out there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly that. But back to Biden, the article mentions he's been on Facebook and Twitter saying mail-in voting is totally accurate and not fraudulent, without getting fact-checked, especially on Facebook.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly that. But back to Biden, the article mentions he's been on Facebook and Twitter saying mail-in voting is totally accurate and not fraudulent, without getting fact-checked, especially on Facebook.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite this, Trump has taken to Facebook and Twitter a number of times to make false claims about mail-in voting being inaccurate and fraudulent without being fact-checked...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: I remember Twitter actually flagged some of his stuff back in June, didn't they? He wasn't too happy about that, if I recall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I remember Twitter actually flagged some of his stuff back in June, didn't they? He wasn't too happy about that, if I recall.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trumps grumbles on Twitter about mail-in voting were flagged by the platform in May with a note that read: Get the facts about mail-in ballots...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, he definitely wasn't! He actually, uh, accused them of trying to interfere in the election. But Facebook, up until now, had even removed *labels* they had on voting info.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, he definitely wasn't! He actually, uh, accused them of trying to interfere in the election. But Facebook, up until now, had even removed labels they had on voting info.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Up until now, Facebook had been adding labels to information about voting below such posts, including by Trumpa feature that was introduced in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. So, what's Zuckerberg's game here, you think? He's been under so much pressure about misinformation already.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. So, what's Zuckerberg's game here, you think? He's been under so much pressure about misinformation already.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A battle with the White House over voting by mail would be unwelcome to Mark Zuckerberg who is already under pressure to address Facebook's role in spreading misinformation...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. I mean, the article frames Facebook as a "key battlefield" for this election. He's got, like, staff backlash, pressure over Russian propaganda. It's a lot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. I mean, the article frames Facebook as a key battlefield for this election. He's got, like, staff backlash, pressure over Russian propaganda. It's a lot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook is a key battlefield for the 2020 election...under pressure to address Facebook's role in spreading misinformation and Russian-backed propaganda in the 2016, while facing a backlash from his staff...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's always defended himself by saying companies shouldn't be "arbiters of truth." But then you have these reports saying Facebook execs *did* defend progressive voices from fact-checking. So, uh, inconsistency there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's always defended himself by saying companies shouldn't be arbiters of truth. But then you have these reports saying Facebook execs did defend progressive voices from fact-checking. So, uh, inconsistency there?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...investigations from Buzzfeed and NBC News revealed that Facebook executives shielded conservative voices, and media organizations from the site's fact-checking process.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a bit. And to top it off, did you know only about 10% of American voters are eligible to vote by mail? That's, like, the smallest figure ever.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a bit. And to top it off, did you know only about ten percent of American voters are eligible to vote by mail? That's, like, the smallest figure ever.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 76%. Thats how many American voters are eligible to vote by mail, the largest figure in history, according to the New York Times.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wow, 10%? That's really low. So this whole mail-in voting debate, it's about a smaller slice of the pie than I even realized.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, ten percent? That's really low. So this whole mail-in voting debate, it's about a smaller slice of the pie than I even realized.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? So this new hub, it's a big move, but it's, uh, pretty loaded with history and contradiction, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So this new hub, it's a big move, but it's, uh, pretty loaded with history and contradiction, wouldn't you say?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It feels like they're trying to walk a very, very fine line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It feels like they're trying to walk a very, very fine line.
